_comment: This file is the authoritative source of truth for task execution state. The markdown plan file is read-only reference documentation. Use status-cli.js to update task status.

tasks.description: Map all plan-related files and their relationships
tasks.notes: Mapped all plan-related files in .claude/commands/plan/ and scripts/, documented relationships and state files
Documented orchestrator execution loop, parallelization rules, batch sizing, and error handling
Analyzed implement execution flow, agent strategies, read-only pattern, and task lifecycle

tasks.description: Identify current execution flow (sequential vs parallel)
tasks.notes: Identified parallelism levels (plans=NO, phases=LIMITED, tasks=YES, agents=YES), sequential enforcement rules
Documented dependency sources, constraint parsing, 80% phase threshold, retry/stuck mechanisms

tasks.description: Investigate if multiple plans can run concurrently
tasks.notes: Analyzed current-plan.txt singleton constraint preventing concurrent plans
Identified shared resources: current-plan.txt, git working dir, filesystem. Status.json is properly isolated per-plan.

tasks.description: Document potential conflicts (file locks, status tracking)
tasks.notes: Documented conflict scenarios: pointer overwrite, git conflicts, file lock issues. Created conflict matrix and severity assessment.
Analyzed isolation requirements: R1-Plan context isolation, R2-Git operation isolation, R3-File system conflict detection. Defined minimum viable and full isolation requirements.
Identified 5 coordination patterns: Independent Plans, Sequential Queue, Resource-Based Coordination, Worktree Isolation, Meta-Orchestrator. Created implementation priority roadmap.

tasks.description: Examine phase dependencies in current plans
tasks.notes: Examined phase dependencies in 6 plans: documentation-cleanup, high-priority-fixes, tui-integration, git-workflow, plan-system-analysis, parallel-execution

tasks.description: Identify phases that could run in parallel
tasks.notes: Identified parallel phase opportunities: high-priority-fixes has 30-40% potential, documentation-cleanup has 15% potential, most plans are sequential

tasks.description: Analyze VERIFY task implications for parallel phases
tasks.notes: Analyzed VERIFY as synchronization barriers: strict vs relaxed enforcement, VERIFY task categories, implications for phase overlap
Documented 4 synchronization mechanisms needed: phase barrier, resource lock, dependency wait, VERIFY gate. Created synchronization matrix.
Identified 5 patterns: Independent Parallel, Staggered Pipeline, Fork-Join, Conditional, Dependency DAG. Created applicability matrix.
Analyzed task-level dependency patterns including [SEQUENTIAL] annotations, implicit phase ordering, and file conflict detection mechanisms

tasks.description: Identify tasks that could run in parallel
tasks.notes: Identified ~65% of tasks are parallel candidates; documented [SEQUENTIAL] usage patterns and safeguards

tasks.description: Analyze task output/artifact handling for parallel execution
tasks.notes: Analyzed status.json locking, atomic writes, task-isolated findings, and read-only agent pattern

tasks.description: Document task synchronization and fan-in/fan-out patterns
tasks.notes: Documented 80% phase barrier, fan-out via parallel agents, fan-in via TaskOutput, and [SEQUENTIAL] enforcement
Reviewed cmdNext() algorithm, plan:batch skill, and orchestrator autonomous loop implementation
Documented independent parallel execution pattern with architecture, implementation, and metrics
Documented dependency-aware DAG-based parallel execution pattern with implementation and graph algorithms
Documented batched parallel execution pattern (current default) with batch selection and sizing
Documented pipeline parallelism pattern with phase overlap and non-blocking VERIFY
Created comprehensive tradeoff comparison with metrics, decision flowchart, and implementation roadmap
Created prioritized opportunity matrix with impact/effort scores across 10 parallelism opportunities in 3 tiers

tasks.description: Identify quick wins vs architectural changes
tasks.notes: Documented 5 quick wins (1-3 days each), 5 medium-term improvements (1-2 weeks), and 3 architectural changes (1-2 months) with implementation details

Documented 7 risks with severity assessment: race conditions (HIGH), git conflicts (HIGH), status corruption (MEDIUM), agent timeouts (MEDIUM), complexity explosion (HIGH), dependency cycles (MEDIUM), resource exhaustion (MEDIUM). Provided code examples for mitigations.

Created 8-week implementation roadmap with 4 phases: Foundation (Week 1-2), Enhanced Parallelism (Week 3-4), Plan Isolation (Week 5-6), Advanced Features (Week 7-8). Includes decision points, success criteria, and rollback plan.
